```{python}
#| label: fig-current-mirror-cascode
#| echo: false
#| fig-cap: "A cascoded current mirror using a biasing voltage to set the cascode gate potential."
import schemdraw as sd
import schemdraw.elements as elm
sd.svgconfig.svg2 = False
with sd.Drawing(canvas='svg') as d:
    d.config(unit=2)
    d.config(fontsize=16)

    elm.Vdd()
    ibias = elm.SourceI().down().label(r'$I_\mathrm{bias}$').dot()
    M3 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).drop('source').theta(0).label('$W_2/L_2$')
    elm.Line().down(d.unit/2)
    M1 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).drop('source').theta(0).label('$W_1/L_1$')
    elm.Ground()
    elm.Line().right(d.unit/4).at(M1.gate).dot()
    elm.Line().up().toy(ibias.end)
    elm.Line().left().to(ibias.end)

    elm.Line().right().at(M1.gate).length(d.unit*1.5)
    M2 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('gate').drop('drain').theta(0).reverse().label(r'$k \cdot W_1/L_1$', ofst=-2.8)
    elm.Line().up(d.unit/2)
    M4 = elm.AnalogNFet(offset_gate=False).anchor('source').theta(0).reverse().label(r'$k \cdot W_2/L_2$', ofst=-2.8)
    elm.Ground().at(M2.source)
    elm.Line().at(M4.drain).up().length(d.unit/2).dot(open=True).label(r'$I_\mathrm{out} = k \cdot I_\mathrm{bias}$', 'right')

    elm.Line().right(d.unit*3/4).at(M3.gate).dot()
    d.push()
    elm.Line().right().to(M4.gate)
    d.pop()
    elm.SourceV().down().toy(M1.source).reverse().label(r'$V_\mathrm{bias}$', loc='bottom')
    elm.Ground()
```
